footer.heading: About
footer.paragraph:
This platform has been brought to you by the Flowminder Foundation, in collaboration with Digicel Haiti, to enable the increased access to and use of mobile operator data in ways that are ethically sound, financially viable, and sustainable for the wellbeing of all in Haiti.

Discover our Haiti Mobility Reports

sidebar.loading_guidance:
Here you can read about the methods that were used to compute the indicator.

Please select an indicator to continue.

dashboard.unapproved1: Sorry, you can't use the dashboard until your account has been approved.
dashboard.unapproved2: We aim to review your application within 10 working days. You will receive an email once your account has been approved.
dashboard.unverified1: You need to verify your email address to continue.
dashboard.unverified2:
### This is to keep your details, and the data, safe and in good hands.

To become a verified user, please check your inbox (and possibly spam folder) and click on the button "verify your email".  You will be asked to log in with the email address you've used to sign up.

Once both your email address has been verified, and your account has been approved by Flowminder, you will be able to access the dashboard and associated data.
dashboard.logged_out1: You need to be logged in to access the dashboard and data.
dashboard.logged_out2:
Please log in to access the dashboard.

Not yet registered? Please create an account.

dashboard.map_parameters_inexistent: The current indicator doesn't have any map parameters.
dashboard.sidebar_info: Click on the info bar on the left for information on the indicators and their methods.
dashboard.graph_view_not_supported: Graph view is not currently supported for flows.
dashboard.slider_text: Please select an indicator to see the time slider.

Your email address has not been verified.
We try to keep your details safe and only allow viewing your profile for verified users.

register.modal_text: Please note that the Haiti Mobility Data Platform is in the first phase of the development. Usage and access to the dashboard is currently restricted for the purposes of testing and providing feedback.
register.heading:
Welcome to the account registration process,

and thank you for your interest in our Haiti mobility data.
register.text01: The account registration process is manual.
register.text02: This means that your registration will only be complete after we have checked and approved your details.
register.text03:
This step is necessary to ensure only approved users get access.

The reason for this is that our data are compiled using both

*commercially-sensitive* and *personal data*.
register.text04:
This data originates from Digicel Haiti and is subject to strict licensing terms.

Vetting users ensures that all of the data are used responsibly.
register.text05:
In addition to the standard [terms & conditions](/terms) and [privacy policy](/privacy), we also provide an easy-to-understand version of both documents.

We explain in both what data we collect, process and how it is used.

You can easily switch between the two versions of the page themselves.
register.plan_text: Please select your plan / account type:
register.premium_plan_text: *Please note that premium accounts are not granted straight away. We will contact you via email to initiate the process. Premium accounts are granted to users upon validation, the user's signature of the T&Cs, and payment of the subscription fee.
register.email: Email address (when possible, please use your work email address)
register.email_error: Please enter a valid email address.
register.org_error: Please enter the name of the organisation you're signing up on behalf of
register.org_address_error: Please enter the address of the organisation you're signing up on behalf of
register.purpose_text: What will you be using the data for
register.purpose_example: e.g. To plan locations for new healthcare facilities
register.purpose_error: Please tell us about your plans for using these data
register.terms_error: You must agree to the terms and conditions.
register.terms_popup_content:
Once your account has been created, you will be able to:
  • Visualise, and interact with, the data via the dashboard functionality
  • Download the data
  • Store the service data and manipulated data on a customer terminal
  • Manipulate the data and create derived data for internal purposes only
Without express written approval from Flowminder, you shall not:
  • Incorporate service data or derived data into external publications
  • Share the service data, derived data, and access to the platform with unauthorised users
register.no_harm: I promise not to do any harm and use these data only for good
register.privacy: I consent to my data being stored and processed accordingly to the [privacy policy](/privacy)
register.privacy_error: You must agree to the privacy policy.
register.privacy_popup_content:
üö® Are you sure you've read our [privacy policy](/privacy)?

Here's a quick recap:

 

üëâ we'll store the data you've given us in this registration form

üëâ we'll also store metadata such as your IP address

üëâ You can delete your account at any time

 

We still recommend you have a look at our brand-new user-friendly [privacy policy](/privacy).
register.marketing: Please contact me about new products and services. *We may contact you from time to time (no more than once a month).*
register.text14: Thank you for registering. You can now create your account using the link below.
register.text15:
# Account verification

You will receive a **verification email** once you have created your account. **Please check your spam folder.**
register.text16:
If you have not received your verification email within 5 minutes of signing up, please contact us at haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org.

To avoid future issues, we recommend you add our email to your **list of trusted senders**.

about.title: About
about.heading1: This platform was brought to you by the Flowminder Foundation, in collaboration with Digicel Haiti, and with the support of the Agence Fran√ßaise de D√©veloppement, the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation, and the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA).
about.text1: With this solution, we aim to support the attainment of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, accurate and robust CDR-based mobility information produced by our open-source FlowKit software. Please note that this is a beta version of the Haiti Mobility Data Platform, which is still undergoing development.
about.text2: The collaboration between Digicel Haiti and Flowminder dates back to the Haiti earthquake of 2010. Thanks to the support of the Agence Fran√ßaise de D√©veloppement (French Development Agency, AFD), the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation and the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA), Flowminder, in collaboration with Digicel Haiti, aims to spur the use of mobile network operator data for public-good purposes in a privacy preserving manner. More specifically, the goal of this initiative is to enable ethically sound access to and use of anonymised and aggregated mobility data in Haiti to bring about improvements in the Haitian population well-being through better response to disasters, public resource allocation, infrastructure planning, and accelerated achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals.
about.text3:
The team behind Flowminder are pioneers in the use of mobile operator data for international development and humanitarian use. Flowminder is a non-profit with over a decade experience in using Call Detail Records (CDR data), geospatial and survey data, to improve the wellbeing of vulnerable populations in low- and middle-income countries. Flowminder provides information and capacity strengthening to governments, mobile network operators, national and international agencies and researchers in such countries for humanitarian and development purposes.

As a Digital Operator, Digicel is in the business of delivering powerful digital experiences 1440 minutes of each day to customers - that's every minute, all day, every day. Serving consumer and business customers in 31 markets in the Caribbean, Central America and Pacific, its investments of over US$7 billion and a commitment to its communities through its Digicel Foundations in Haiti, Jamaica, Papua New Guinea and Trinidad & Tobago have contributed to positive outcomes for over 3 million people to date. With its Better Together brand, Digicel is making a promise of simply more to customers and communities and its 7,000 employees worldwide work together to make that a powerful reality day in, day out. Visit digicelgroup.com for more.
about.heading4: About the Ethics & Governance Advisory Committee
about.text4: The role of the national Advisory board is to ensure that the analytical outputs of the programme are fair, ethical and transparent. The board will be composed of representatives of the civil society  and they will provide  input and counsel on privacy-related issues and address items such as the legitimate purpose in the use of algorithms, bias, applications, users, unintended consequences. They will also engage more widely with the community  and communicate transparently about the activity of the programme. The general objectives of the Ethics & Governance Advisory Committee are: (1) to ensure the data products are used in an ethical manner that supports the benefit of Haitian society, (2) facilitating and supporting the transparency toward civil society.

explore.title: Explore
explore.heading1: Why is the Haiti mobility data platform important?
explore.text1:
**Understanding where people live, work or commute to is an asset** for those planning, implementing, monitoring or evaluating public policies or those advising on resource allocations in emergencies, post disaster recovery or disaster risk reduction interventions contexts.

The private sector is also likely to benefit from insights on where people are for investment decisions.

 

### Discover below how to use the dashboard and what data are available.
explore.heading2: Start exploring the data now
explore.text3: Please note that this is a beta version of the Haiti Mobility Data Platform, which is still undergoing development. The website, its data and all content found on it can be provided on an ‚Äúas is‚Äù and ‚Äúas available‚Äù basis. Should you encounter any bugs or other problems on the site or dashboard, please let us know immediately by emailing haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org so we can rectify these accordingly. The dashboard can be accessed [here](/), provided you're logged in. You will first need to register and create an account. Find out more about our account types [here](/pricing). We've also put together a short tutorial to help you navigate the platform. You will be able to go through it when you first log on and get to the dashboard. It will also be available via your profile account. Data on the platform are indicators that are produced from pseudonymised Call Detail Records (CDR data) provided by Digicel Haiti. These indicators provide only anonymised and aggregated results. To understand how these are produced, visit FlowGeek, our online knowledge centre for all things CDR.
explore.heading4: We've created an entire section dedicated to supporting you explore the dashboard easily, and understand the ethical and data security principles governing our work.
explore.text4:
You might want to create an account first, but here is what you can expect in the tutorial:

* Dashboard overview
* Account management
* Ethics
* Help

intro.sub_heading: Mobility information across Haiti, all in one place.
intro.heading1: Welcome to Haiti's first mobility dashboard, brought to you by Flowminder & Digicel Haiti, to provide you with a unique set of dynamic population and mobility indicators that can be used to support public and private sectors' decision making, and inform policies and programmes for the benefits of all in Haiti.
intro.text1: The Haiti Mobility Data Platform is funded by the Agence Fran√ßaise de D√©veloppement, the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation, and the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA). We use robust and transparent analysis and modelling methods to estimate mobility and dynamic population density in Haiti to provide users with an understanding of people's movements and locations across time.
intro.heading2: Embrace the power of mobile operator data analytics
intro.text2: The uniqueness of the platform relies on its main data source: pseudonymised Call Detail Records - a type of mobile operator data - provided by Digicel Haiti and processed by Flowminder, in combination with other data sources to give the most accurate picture of population movements and density across the country.

Set up your account,
pick your plan later.
pricing.heading2: We currently have two plans available: the **free** and the **premium** plans
pricing.functionality_3: Visualise data in map, chart and graph format

pricing.text3: Regardless of the plan you need, you will first need to create a Free account to be able to upgrade to Premium. Please note that you are currently interacting with a beta version of the platform
pricing.faq_heading1: How long are the plans valid for?
pricing.faq_text1: Both our free and premium account plans are valid for one year from the day of validation. For the premium accounts, we will then send you a revised order form to renew your subscription.
pricing.faq_text2: You must first create a Free account to be able to upgrade to Premium.
pricing.faq_text3: You are not required to provide a means of payment to apply for a free account. For Premium plans, an order form will be emailed to you describing the terms and conditions and payment method.

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.text1: You will find below a user-friendly and a legal version of our privacy notice.
privacy.text2: Click on the relevant tab to see the version that is most suitable for you.
privacy.simple_intro1: In order to provide this service, and guarantee only authorised parties have access, we need to collect some data in accordance with data protection regulations.
privacy.simple_intro2: We currently collect the following data (some of it optionally):
privacy.data1_hint: We need a unique identifier for your user account.
privacy.data2_hint: You can optionally set your preferred language for this website. If you don't set it, it will default to English.
privacy.data3_hint: This restricts when we can contact you.
privacy.data4_hint: This is captured automatically and helps us to comply with data protection laws
privacy.data7: The last browser you used to access our service
privacy.data7_hint: This helps us to make our service compatible with your browser and improve your experience.
privacy.data8: The last IP address you used to access our service
privacy.data8_hint: This is captured automatically but we do not currently use this information.
privacy.data10: Your job title within your organisation (optional)
privacy.data11: The industry sector your organisation operates in (optional)
privacy.example_regular: View example data for a regular account
privacy.sso_text: If you choose to log in with an existing account instead of creating a username and password with us ("single sign-on"), we also collect the following information:
privacy.data14_hint: Your identity provider will ask for your consent to share this with us. This may include your name, nickname, profile picture and language.
privacy.example_sso: View example data for a single sign-on account
privacy.end_text: We may change what data we collect in the future. If we do, you will be notified of the change in advance and have the option to opt-out or close your account.
privacy.download: Please click here to download the privacy policy in PDF format

sub_privacy.title: Subscriber privacy information
sub_privacy.simple_text: Globally, the number of mobile subscribers is continuously growing. People use mobile devices for calling and texting friends, browsing the internet or using mobile money. Once the data generated by the use of these devices are processed, aggregated, and anonymised to protect the privacy of subscribers, they can be used to generate important insights about population distributions and movement patterns. These insights can help target aid after a disaster or help improve public resource allocation policies and henceforth speed up the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The collaboration between Flowminder and Digicel Haiti, which started in the aftermath of the 2010 earthquake, yielded this Haiti mobility dashboard. It provides access to anonymised information on population distributions and flows in Haiti in order to inform policies that will help Haiti meet its SDGs. The population distribution and mobility indicators available through the dashboard only describe the changes in the distribution and mobility of groups of subscribers in an area as whole, preventing individuals from being identified or traced. The privacy of mobile phone subscribers is indeed central to this project. All indicators are anonymised and aggregated. These indicators are produced using Call Detail Records (CDRs), a type of mobile operator phone data. These data are routinely used by Digicel Haiti for billing purposes, meaning no additional data is being collected or stored for the purpose of producing the indicators. CDRs are generated only when a subscriber uses their mobile device to make or receive a call, send or receive a message or use mobile data (we call these ‚Äúnetwork events‚Äù). CDRs only record the nearest cell tower (i.e. not the subscriber', 's exact location), and the content of the network events is not recorded: what is written in an SMS and said in a call is never recorded. You can find out more about CDR data here. To preserve the security of subscribers', ' personal data, the CDR data remain behind Digicel Haiti', 's firewall (a type of cyber defence protecting IT systems from an external intrusion). Pseudonymised CDRs, which have had identifying information replaced with randomly generated values, are then transferred onto a Flowminder server, also installed behind Digicel', 's firewalls in Haiti. The data are then aggregated, anonymised, scaled and adjusted on this server. Only then can these data be retrieved from behind the firewall to produce indicators requested by authorised users on the dashboard.

terms.title: Terms & conditions
terms.text1: You will find below a **user-friendly** and a **legal** version of our terms & conditions.
terms.text2: Click on the relevant tab to access the version that is most suitable for you.
terms.download: Please click here to download the terms and conditions in PDF format.
terms.simple_intro2: Our licensing terms give you peace of mind to use our data while ensuring that use is responsible.
terms.simple_intro3:
Welcome to the Haiti Mobility Dashboard developed by Flowminder. The platform provides access to authorised users to interactive visualisations of pre-computed and anonymised mobility indicators based on Digicel‚Äôs pseudonymised call detail records (CDR data), and Flowminder Foundation's data processing and analytical methods.

The current version of the platform is a beta product.

Once your account has been created, you will be able to:
  • Visualise, and interact with, the data via the dashboard functionality
  • Download the data
  • Store the service data and manipulated data on a customer terminal
  • Manipulate the data and create derived data for internal purposes only
Please note that premium accounts are not granted straight away. We will contact you via email to initiate the process. Premium accounts are granted to users upon validation, the user's signature of the T&Cs, and payment of the subscription fee. Without express written approval from Flowminder (contact us at haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org), you shall not:
  • Incorporate service data or derived data into external publications
  • Share the service data, derived data, and access to the platform with unauthorised users

tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.welcome_heading: Welcome to the Haiti Mobility Dashboard, where you can access timely and accurate data on mobility in Haiti.
tutorial.welcome1: In this section, you will find documentation to help you get started, make the most of the platform's capabilities, and understand the ethics and processes behind the platform.
tutorial.welcome2: Find out more about 'dashboard overview'; 'account management'; 'ethics'; and how to 'get help'.
tutorial.welcome_banner: Would you like a tour of the application?
tutorial.welcome_bullet1:
### Using the dashboard
- Discover how to use the platform and associated data, and explore the features available to make the most of your plan.
tutorial.welcome_bullet2:
### Account management
- Your profile: learn how to access and edit your profile, and pick your preferred settings.
- Terms & conditions: Access our legal and user-friendly T&Cs to better manage your licence entitlements
- Changing plans: Learn about our plans and how to take your work to the next level
tutorial.welcome_bullet3:
### Ethics
- Flowminder & Digicel are committed to transparency in how we deal with data, from the CDR data being processed, to the data collected via the platform to run this service.
tutorial.welcome_bullet4:
### Help
- Find out how to contact us for general support or data queries.
tutorial.tab_menu: Click on one of the tabs below to select your tutorial of interest
tutorial.sections_links: Click on the hyperlinks below to jump to the relevant sections
tutorial.dashboard_text_box: The data ingested into the dashboard comes from [FlowKit](https://flowkit.xyz), [Flowminder](https://www.flowminder.org/)'s toolkit for processing and analysing the pseudonymised Call Detail Records (CDR data) provided by Digicel Haiti.
tutorial.dashboard_heading0: The platform has been designed to facilitate use of the data, through user-friendly access and visualisation.
tutorial.dashboard_text0: You can therefore interact with the outputs, visualise different indicators and scenarios, before exporting the data.
tutorial.dashboard_text1:
The data dashboard can only be accessed when *you have created an account and are logged in*, regardless of the plan you subscribed to. Plans mostly affect the type of indicators, metrics and parameters you can choose from. Find out more about our plans [here](/explore).

1. To create an account, click [here](/register), or press the yellow button on the menu **[1]**
2. You can access the dashboard through the menu header **[2]**
tutorial.dashboard_text2:
The platform contains a large number of indicators, split across four main categories: Residents, Relocations, Daily presence and Daily movements
1. Select a category of indicator **[1]**
2. Click on the dropdown list to select an indicator. **[2]** This will load some default data. As default, the results will be displayed as a map. We will explain a bit below how to change the view.
tutorial.dashboard_text3:
Parameters include selecting spatial and temporal resolution for your indicator. These vary from an indicator to another, and based on your plan.
1. Once an indicator is selected, you will be able to set parameters for your selection **[1]**
2. Once parameters are selected, a new map will be loaded **[2]**
3. If a parameter is greyed out, this means that you require a Premium account to access such a level of granularity. To change plans, read the account management section of this tutorial. **[3]**
tutorial.dashboard_text4:
Indicators are generated by processing anonymised and aggregated CDR data to adjust for variation in mobile network activity (i.e. changes in the frequency with which subscribers use their mobile phones). They are combined with other data (e.g. baseline values from a reference period) to provide more nuanced descriptions of population distributions and mobility. Indicators may also be adjusted to address representativeness biases.
We've put together some descriptions and explanations for each indicator, which you can access as follows:
1. A short description of the selected indicator will appear at the top of the dashboard. This is to give you a brief overview of the data you are looking at. **[1]**
2. If you click on the blue side bar, on the left of the dashboard, you will see a more detailed description of the indicator, including a brief explanation on how it is calculated. **[2]**
3. Finally, at the bottom of the sidebar, you will find a 'Read more' button. This will direct you to [FlowGeek](https://www.flowgeek.org/), Flowminder's knowledge centre on CDR analytics. There, you will be able to read a thorough description of the method and how the indicator is calculated and adjusted for. Information on use and limitations will also be available. **[3]**
tutorial.dashboard_text5:
Different visualisation modes are available: map, graph and table. The map view is selected by default. To change visualisation type:
1. Log in and go onto the dashboard
2. In the top right corner, you will see the map view icon. **[1]**
3. Click on the icon, until your preferred visualisation appears.
tutorial.dashboard_text6: All you need to do is to click ‚Äúdownload‚Äù on the right hand side of the dashboard. It will download the currently selected indicators and parameters, in a csv file. Please be aware that some downloads might take longer than others, depending on the volume of the data that needs to be downloaded.
tutorial.account_heading1: How to access & edit your profile
tutorial.account_text2: Check out the [Pricing page](/pricing) for more information on our plans. On the registration page, you will be asked to select the plan you want. If you've requested and have created a free plan and would like to upgrade to Premium, please email [haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org](mailto:haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org).
tutorial.ethics_heading1: Privacy notices & information on personal data
tutorial.ethics_text2:
You can access the terms and conditions (licencing terms) in the footer of the platform, or by clicking [here](/terms).

We would like to draw your attention to the following elements:
1. tbc
2. tbc
3. tbc
tutorial.help_heading1: Contact us for general support or data queries.
tutorial.help_text1: For more information on the work, or on how to use the platform, please contact us at [haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org](mailto:haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org).
tutorial.help_text2: You can also contact us to request bespoke support or consultancy projects, such as mobility analysis for a specific sector or application, or to request data training support or capacity strengthening. Email us at [haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org](mailto:haiti.mobility-dashboard@flowminder.org).

contact.title: Contact us
contact.text1: You can get in touch if you need help or you can let us know how you like our platform.
contact.text2: We'll try to be in touch as soon as we can!

logged_out.title: Logged out
logged_out.text1: Log back in to continue using the platform.
